<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Adapted Cantrip](/Feats.aspx?ID=66) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=90" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 57 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
spellcasting class feature

</column>

---

Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style. Choose one cantrip from a magical tradition other than your own. If you have a spell repertoire or a spellbook, replace one of the cantrips you know or have in your spellbook with the chosen spell. If you prepare spells without a spellbook (if you're a [cleric](/Classes.aspx?ID=5) or [druid](/Classes.aspx?ID=6), for example), one of your cantrips must always be the chosen spell, and you prepare the rest normally. You can cast this cantrip as a spell of your class's tradition.

 If you swap or retrain this cantrip later, you can choose its replacement from the same alternate tradition or a different one.

<title level="2">Adapted Cantrip leads to...</title>
[Adaptive Adept](/Feats.aspx?ID=73)
